speakers.name: JUSTICE ALITO

speakers.name: JUSTICE KAGAN

They are doing a thousand other things as well about how they think it's best to arrange their docket.  And what we don't know is whether the Tenth Circuit here did one of those things.

speakers.name: JUSTICE KAGAN

speakers.text: Well, all the Class Action Fairness Act says is, I believe, is that the court may take the case.  It doesn't -- it doesn't specify the scope of discretion.  It doesn't say it's absolute.

speakers.name: JUSTICE ALITO
speakers.text: Outside of the Class Action Fairness Act, may a district court -- is a court of appeals barred from reviewing a decision of the district court to remand the case based on docket control?

speakers.name: JUSTICE ALITO
speakers.text: Can we infer anything from that as to whether Congress thought that that would be a proper reason under the Class Action Fairness Act?

speakers.name: CHIEF JUSTICE ROBERTS
speakers.text: You can't escape that easily.

speakers.name: CHIEF JUSTICE ROBERTS
speakers.text: Thank you, counsel.

speakers.name: CHIEF JUSTICE ROBERTS
speakers.text: Mr. Berreth, you have three minutes remaining.

speakers.name: CHIEF JUSTICE ROBERTS
speakers.text: Thank you, counsel. Alderson Reporting Company The case is submitted.
